intro: Agyneia ovata, commonly known as the oval agyneia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Agyneia ovata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
